00094 void
00095 syx_object_initialize (SyxOop oop)
00096 {
00097   SyxOop process;
00098   SyxOop context;
00099 
00100   /* initialize only if the interpreter is running */
00101   if (syx_system_initialized)
00102     {
00103       process = syx_process_new ();
00104       context = syx_send_unary_message (oop, "initialize");
00105       syx_interp_enter_context (process, context);
00106       syx_process_execute_blocking (process);
00107     }
00108 }
00109 
00115 void
00116 syx_object_resize (SyxOop object, syx_varsize size)
00117 {
00118   if (SYX_OBJECT_HAS_REFS (object))
00119     SYX_OBJECT_DATA(object) = (SyxOop *) syx_realloc (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(object),
00120                                                       size * sizeof (SyxOop));
00121   else
00122     SYX_OBJECT_DATA(object) = (SyxOop *) syx_realloc (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(object),
00123                                                       size * sizeof (syx_int8));
00124 
00125   SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE(object) = size;
00126 }

00138 SyxOop 
00139 syx_metaclass_new (SyxOop supermetaclass)
00140 {
00141   SyxOop metaclass = syx_object_new (syx_metaclass_class);
00142   SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS(metaclass) = supermetaclass;
00143   SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_SIZE(metaclass) = SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_SIZE(supermetaclass);
00144   SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_VARIABLES(metaclass) = syx_array_new (0, NULL);
00145   SYX_CLASS_METHODS(metaclass) = syx_dictionary_new (50);
00146 
00147   SYX_CLASS_SUBCLASSES(metaclass) = syx_array_new (0, NULL);
00148   syx_array_add (SYX_CLASS_SUBCLASSES(supermetaclass), metaclass, TRUE);
00149   return metaclass;
00150 }
00151 
00160 SyxOop 
00161 syx_class_new (SyxOop superclass)
00162 {
00163   SyxOop metaclass = syx_metaclass_new (syx_object_get_class (superclass));
00164   SyxOop klass = syx_object_new (metaclass);
00165   SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS(klass) = superclass;
00166   SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_SIZE(klass) = SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_SIZE(superclass);
00167   SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_VARIABLES(klass) = syx_array_new (0, NULL);
00168   SYX_METACLASS_INSTANCE_CLASS(metaclass) = klass;
00169   SYX_CLASS_METHODS(klass) = syx_dictionary_new (50);
00170 
00171   SYX_CLASS_SUBCLASSES(klass) = syx_array_new (0, NULL);
00172   syx_array_add (SYX_CLASS_SUBCLASSES(superclass), klass, TRUE);
00173   return klass;
00174 }

00184 SyxOop
00185 syx_large_integer_new (syx_symbol string, syx_int32 base)
00186 {
00187 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00188   mpz_t *z = syx_calloc (1, sizeof (mpz_t));
00189   SyxOop oop;
00190   mpz_init_set_str (*z, string, 10);
00191   oop = syx_object_new_data (syx_large_integer_class, FALSE, sizeof (mpz_t), (SyxOop *)z);
00192   return oop;
00193 #endif
00194   return syx_nil;
00195 }
00196 
00198 SyxOop
00199 syx_large_integer_new_mpz (syx_pointer mpz)
00200 {
00201 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00202   SyxOop oop;
00203   oop = syx_object_new_data (syx_large_integer_class, FALSE, sizeof (mpz_t), (SyxOop *)mpz);
00204   return oop;
00205 #endif
00206   return syx_nil;
00207 }
00208 
00214 SyxOop
00215 syx_large_integer_new_integer (syx_int32 i)
00216 {
00217 #ifdef HAVE_LIBGMP
00218   mpz_t *z = syx_calloc (1, sizeof (mpz_t));
00219   SyxOop oop;
00220   mpz_init_set_si (*z, i);
00221   oop = syx_object_new_data (syx_large_integer_class, FALSE, sizeof (mpz_t), (SyxOop *)z);
00222   return oop;
00223 #endif
00224   return syx_nil;
00225 }

00227 
00233 SyxOop 
00234 syx_process_new (void)
00235 {
00236   SyxInterpFrame *frame;
00237   SyxOop object = syx_object_new (syx_process_class);
00238   SYX_PROCESS_STACK(object) = syx_array_new_size (5000);
00239   SYX_PROCESS_SUSPENDED(object) = syx_true;
00240   SYX_PROCESS_SCHEDULED(object) = syx_false;
00241 
00242   /* initialize the first frame to avoid null checks in the interpreter */
00243   frame = (SyxInterpFrame *) SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (SYX_PROCESS_STACK (object)));
00244   /* the stack pointer is used to get the next available frame, which in our case is the bottom
00245      of the process stack */
00246   frame->stack = (SyxOop *) frame;
00247   SYX_PROCESS_FRAME_POINTER(object) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (frame);
00248 
00249   syx_scheduler_add_process (object);
00250   return object;
00251 }
00252 
00253 
00259 syx_bool
00260 syx_array_remove (SyxOop array, SyxOop element)
00261 {
00262   syx_varsize i, size;
00263   syx_bool found = FALSE;
00264 
00265   size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (array);
00266   for (i=0; i < size; i++)
00267     {
00268       if (found)
00269         SYX_OBJECT_DATA(array)[i-1] = SYX_OBJECT_DATA(array)[i];
00270 
00271       if (SYX_OOP_EQ (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (array)[i], element))
00272         found = TRUE;
00273     }
00274 
00275   if (found)
00276     syx_object_resize (array, size - 1);
00277 
00278   return found;
00279 }
00280 
00281 
00282 
00288 void
00289 syx_array_add (SyxOop array, SyxOop element, syx_bool unique)
00290 {
00291   syx_varsize i, size;
00292 
00293   size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (array);
00294 
00295   if (unique)
00296     {
00297       for (i=0; i < size; i++)
00298         {
00299           if (SYX_OOP_EQ (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(array)[i], element))
00300             return;
00301         }
00302     }
00303 
00304   syx_object_grow_by (array, 1);
00305   SYX_OBJECT_DATA(array)[size] = element;
00306 }
00307 
00314 SyxOop 
00315 syx_symbol_new (syx_symbol symbol)
00316 {
00317   SyxOop obj;
00318   syx_int32 index;
00319   SyxOop *table;
00320   syx_int32 tally;
00321   syx_varsize size;
00322   syx_int32 hash;
00323 
00324   if (!symbol)
00325     return syx_nil;
00326 
00327   /* We don't use common dictionary functions to avoid searching the index twice.
00328      See issue #21 */
00329 
00330   tally = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (syx_symbols));
00331   size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (syx_symbols);
00332 
00333   if (tally >= size / 2)
00334     syx_dictionary_rehash (syx_symbols);
00335 
00336   hash = syx_string_hash (symbol);
00337   index = syx_dictionary_index_of (syx_symbols, symbol, hash, TRUE);
00338 
00339   if (index < 0)
00340     syx_error ("Not enough space for dictionary %p\n", SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (syx_symbols));
00341 
00342   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (syx_symbols);
00343   if (!SYX_IS_NIL (table[index]))
00344     return table[index+1];
00345 
00346   obj = syx_object_new_data (syx_symbol_class, FALSE, strlen (symbol) + 1, (SyxOop *)syx_strdup (symbol));
00347   SYX_SYMBOL_HASH(obj) = syx_small_integer_new (hash);
00348   table[index] = obj;
00349   table[index+1] = obj;
00350   SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (syx_symbols) = syx_small_integer_new (tally + 1);
00351 
00352   return obj;
00353 }
00354 
00355 
00357 syx_int32
00358 syx_string_hash (syx_symbol string)
00359 {
00360   syx_int32 ret;
00361   for (ret=0, string = string + 1; *string != '\0'; string++)
00362     ret += *string + *(string - 1);
00363 
00364   if (!SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_CAN_EMBED (ret))
00365     ret >>= 2;
00366 
00367   return SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_EMBED (ret);
00368 }
00369 
00378 syx_int32
00379 syx_dictionary_index_of (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key, syx_int32 hash, syx_bool return_nil_index)
00380 {
00381   SyxOop entry;
00382   syx_varsize size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (dict);
00383   SyxOop *table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00384   syx_varsize i = 2 * (hash % (size / 2));
00385   syx_int32 tally = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (dict)) + return_nil_index;
00386   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00387 
00388 
00389   for (; tally; i+=2)
00390     {
00391       if (i >= size)
00392         i = 0;
00393       entry = table[i];
00394       if (SYX_IS_NIL (entry))
00395         {
00396           if (return_nil_index)
00397             {
00398               SYX_END_PROFILE(dict_access);
00399               return i;
00400             }
00401           else
00402             {
00403               SYX_END_PROFILE(dict_access);
00404               return -1;
00405             }
00406         }
00407       tally--;
00408       if (!strcmp (SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (entry), key))
00409         {
00410           SYX_END_PROFILE(dict_access);
00411           return i;
00412         }
00413     }
00414   SYX_END_PROFILE(dict_access);
00415   return -1;
00416 }
00417 
00425 SyxOop
00426 syx_dictionary_binding_at_symbol (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key)
00427 {
00428   syx_int32 index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, key, syx_string_hash (key), FALSE);
00429   SyxOop *table;
00430   if (index < 0)
00431     {
00432       syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_NOT_FOUND, syx_symbol_new (key));
00433       return syx_nil;
00434     }
00435 
00436   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00437   return syx_variable_binding_new (table[index], index, dict);
00438 }
00439 
00447 SyxOop
00448 syx_dictionary_binding_at_symbol_if_absent (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key, SyxOop object)
00449 {
00450   syx_int32 index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, key, syx_string_hash (key), FALSE);
00451   SyxOop *table;
00452   if (index < 0)
00453     return object;
00454 
00455   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00456   return syx_variable_binding_new (table[index], index, dict);
00457 }
00458 
00466 SyxOop
00467 syx_dictionary_bind (SyxOop binding)
00468 {
00469   SyxOop dict = SYX_VARIABLE_BINDING_DICTIONARY (binding);
00470   SyxOop *table;
00471   SyxOop key;
00472   syx_int32 index;
00473   SyxOop entry;
00474 
00475   if (SYX_IS_NIL (dict))
00476     return syx_nil;
00477 
00478   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00479   key = SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding);
00480   index = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding));
00481   entry = table[index];
00482 
00483   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (entry, key))
00484     return table[index+1];
00485 
00486   index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (key), syx_symbol_hash (key), FALSE);
00487   if (index < 0)
00488     {
00489       syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_NOT_FOUND, key);
00490       return syx_nil;
00491     }
00492 
00493   SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding) = syx_small_integer_new (index);
00494   return table[index+1];
00495 }
00496 
00504 SyxOop
00505 syx_dictionary_bind_if_absent (SyxOop binding, SyxOop object)
00506 {
00507   SyxOop dict = SYX_VARIABLE_BINDING_DICTIONARY (binding);
00508   SyxOop *table;
00509   SyxOop key;
00510   syx_int32 index;
00511   SyxOop entry;
00512   if (SYX_IS_NIL (dict))
00513     return object;
00514 
00515   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00516   key = SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding);
00517   index = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding));
00518   if (index < SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE(dict))
00519     {
00520       entry = table[index];
00521       if (SYX_OOP_EQ (entry, key))
00522         return table[index+1];
00523     }
00524 
00525   index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (key), syx_symbol_hash (key), FALSE);
00526   if (index < 0)
00527     return object;
00528 
00529   SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding) = syx_small_integer_new (index);
00530   return table[index+1];
00531 }
00532 
00539 void
00540 syx_dictionary_bind_set_value (SyxOop binding, SyxOop value)
00541 {
00542   SyxOop dict = SYX_VARIABLE_BINDING_DICTIONARY (binding);
00543   SyxOop *table;
00544   SyxOop key;
00545   syx_int32 index;
00546   SyxOop entry;
00547 
00548   if (SYX_IS_NIL (dict))
00549     return;
00550   
00551   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00552   key = SYX_ASSOCIATION_KEY (binding);
00553   index = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding));
00554   entry = table[index];
00555 
00556   if (SYX_OOP_NE (entry, key))
00557     {
00558       index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (key), syx_symbol_hash (key), FALSE);
00559       if (index < 0)
00560         {
00561           syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_NOT_FOUND, key);
00562           return;
00563         }
00564     }
00565 
00566   SYX_ASSOCIATION_VALUE (binding) = syx_small_integer_new (index);
00567   table[index+1] = value;
00568 }
00569 
00575 SyxOop 
00576 syx_dictionary_at_symbol (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key)
00577 {
00578   syx_int32 index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, key, syx_string_hash (key), FALSE);
00579   if (index < 0)
00580     {
00581       syx_signal (SYX_ERROR_NOT_FOUND, syx_symbol_new (key));
00582       return 0;
00583     }
00584 
00585   return SYX_OBJECT_DATA(dict)[index+1];
00586 }
00587 
00593 SyxOop 
00594 syx_dictionary_at_symbol_if_absent (SyxOop dict, syx_symbol key, SyxOop object)
00595 {
00596   syx_int32 index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, key, syx_string_hash (key), FALSE);
00597   if (index < 0)
00598     return object;
00599 
00600   return SYX_OBJECT_DATA(dict)[index+1];
00601 }
00602 
00604 void
00605 syx_dictionary_rehash (SyxOop dict)
00606 {
00607   syx_varsize size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (dict);
00608   syx_int32 tally = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (dict));
00609   syx_varsize newsize = size * 2;
00610   SyxOop *table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00611   SyxOop newdict = syx_dictionary_new (newsize);
00612   SyxOop entry;
00613   syx_int32 i;
00614 
00615   for (i=0; tally && i < size; i+=2)
00616     {
00617       entry = table[i];
00618       if (!SYX_IS_NIL (entry))
00619         {
00620           syx_dictionary_at_symbol_put (newdict, entry, table[i+1]);
00621           tally--;
00622         }
00623     }
00624 
00625   syx_free (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict));
00626   SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict) = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (newdict);
00627   SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (dict) = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (newdict);
00628   syx_free (SYX_OBJECT_VARS (newdict));
00629   syx_memory_free (newdict);
00630 }
00631 
00632 
00634 void
00635 syx_dictionary_at_symbol_put (SyxOop dict, SyxOop key, SyxOop value)
00636 {
00637   syx_varsize size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (dict);
00638   syx_int32 tally = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (dict));
00639   SyxOop *table;
00640   syx_int32 index;
00641 
00642   if (tally >= size / 2)
00643     syx_dictionary_rehash (dict);
00644 
00645   index = syx_dictionary_index_of (dict, SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (key), syx_symbol_hash (key), TRUE);
00646 
00647   if (index < 0)
00648     syx_error ("Not enough space for dictionary %p\n", SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER (dict));
00649 
00650   table = SYX_OBJECT_DATA (dict);
00651   table[index] = key;
00652   table[index+1] = value;
00653   SYX_DICTIONARY_TALLY (dict) = syx_small_integer_new (tally + 1);
00654 }
00655 
00656 
00664 SyxOop 
00665 syx_method_context_new (SyxOop method, SyxOop receiver, SyxOop arguments)
00666 {
00667   SyxOop object;
00668 
00669   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00670 
00671   syx_memory_gc_begin ();
00672 
00673   object = syx_object_new (syx_method_context_class);
00674 
00675   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER(object) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (NULL);
00676   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_METHOD(object) = method;
00677   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_ARGUMENTS(object) = arguments;
00678   SYX_METHOD_CONTEXT_RECEIVER(object) = receiver;
00679 
00680   syx_memory_gc_end ();
00681 
00682   SYX_END_PROFILE(method_context);
00683 
00684   return object;
00685 }
00686 
00693 SyxOop 
00694 syx_block_context_new (SyxOop closure, SyxOop arguments)
00695 {
00696   SyxOop object;
00697 
00698   SYX_START_PROFILE;
00699 
00700   object = syx_object_new (syx_block_context_class);
00701 
00702   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_FRAME_POINTER(object) = SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP (NULL);
00703   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_METHOD(object) = SYX_BLOCK_CLOSURE_BLOCK (closure);
00704   SYX_CONTEXT_PART_ARGUMENTS(object) = arguments;
00705   SYX_BLOCK_CONTEXT_CLOSURE(object) = closure;
00706 
00707   SYX_END_PROFILE(block_context);
00708 
00709   return object;
00710 }
00711 
00712 /* Object */
00713 
00720 SyxOop
00721 syx_object_new_vars (SyxOop klass, syx_varsize vars_size)
00722 {
00723   SyxOop oop = syx_memory_alloc ();
00724   SyxObject *object = SYX_OBJECT (oop);
00725 
00726   object->klass = klass;
00727   object->has_refs = FALSE;
00728   object->is_constant = FALSE;
00729   object->vars = (SyxOop *) syx_calloc (vars_size, sizeof (SyxOop));
00730   object->data_size = 0;
00731   object->data = NULL;
00732 
00733   return oop;
00734 }
00735 
00742 SyxOop 
00743 syx_object_new_size (SyxOop klass, syx_bool has_refs, syx_varsize size)
00744 {
00745   SyxObject *object = SYX_OBJECT (syx_object_new (klass));
00746 
00747   object->has_refs = has_refs;
00748   object->data_size = size;
00749   object->data = (SyxOop *) (has_refs
00750                              ? syx_calloc (size, sizeof (SyxOop))
00751                              : syx_calloc (size, sizeof (syx_int8)));
00752   return (SyxOop)object;
00753 }
00754 
00762 SyxOop 
00763 syx_object_new_data (SyxOop klass, syx_bool has_refs, syx_varsize size, SyxOop *data)
00764 {
00765   SyxObject *object = SYX_OBJECT (syx_object_new (klass));
00766 
00767   object->has_refs = has_refs;
00768   object->data_size = size;
00769   object->data = data;
00770 
00771   return (SyxOop)object;
00772 }
00773 
00775 SyxOop
00776 syx_object_copy (SyxOop object)
00777 {
00778   SyxOop oop;
00779   SyxObject *obj1;
00780   SyxObject *obj2;
00781 
00782   if (!SYX_IS_OBJECT (object))
00783     return object;
00784 
00785   oop = syx_memory_alloc ();
00786   obj1 = SYX_OBJECT (oop);
00787   obj2 = SYX_OBJECT (object);
00788 
00789   obj1->klass = obj2->klass;
00790   obj1->has_refs = obj2->has_refs;
00791   obj1->is_constant = FALSE;
00792 
00793   obj1->vars = (SyxOop *) syx_memdup (obj2->vars, SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_SIZE (obj1->klass)),
00794                                       sizeof (SyxOop));
00795 
00796   obj1->data_size = obj2->data_size;
00797   if (obj2->data)
00798     {
00799       if (obj1->has_refs)
00800         obj1->data = (SyxOop *) syx_memdup (obj2->data, obj1->data_size, sizeof (SyxOop));
00801       else
00802         obj1->data = (SyxOop *) syx_memdup (obj2->data, obj1->data_size, sizeof (syx_int8));
00803     }
00804 
00805   return oop;
00806 }
00807 
00813 void
00814 syx_object_free (SyxOop object)
00815 {
00816   SyxOop process, context, klass;
00817   if (!SYX_IS_OBJECT (object))
00818     return;
00819 
00820   klass = syx_object_get_class (object);
00821   if (SYX_IS_NIL (klass))
00822     return;
00823 
00824   if (SYX_IS_TRUE (SYX_CLASS_FINALIZATION (klass)))
00825     {
00826       process = syx_process_new ();
00827       context = syx_send_unary_message (object, "finalize");
00828       syx_interp_enter_context (process, context);
00829       syx_process_execute_blocking (process);
00830     }
00831 
00832   if (SYX_OBJECT_VARS (object))
00833     syx_free (SYX_OBJECT_VARS (object));
00834   if (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (object))
00835     syx_free (SYX_OBJECT_DATA (object));
00836   syx_memory_free (object);
00837 }
00838 
00846 syx_bool
00847 syx_class_is_superclass_of (SyxOop klass, SyxOop subclass)
00848 {
00849   SyxOop cur;
00850   if (SYX_OOP_EQ (klass, subclass))
00851     return FALSE;
00852 
00853   cur = SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS (subclass);
00854 
00855   for (; !SYX_IS_NIL (cur) && SYX_OOP_NE(cur, klass); cur=SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS(cur));
00856 
00857   return !SYX_IS_NIL (cur);
00858 }
00859 
00867 syx_symbol *
00868 syx_class_get_all_instance_variable_names (SyxOop klass)
00869 {
00870   syx_symbol names[256];
00871   syx_symbol *ret_names = NULL;
00872   SyxOop inst_vars;
00873   SyxOop inst_var;
00874   syx_varsize i, size, tot_size;
00875 
00876   for (tot_size=0; !SYX_IS_NIL(klass); klass=SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS (klass))
00877     {
00878       inst_vars = SYX_CLASS_INSTANCE_VARIABLES (klass);
00879       size = SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (inst_vars);
00880 
00881       for (i=size; i > 0; i--)
00882         {
00883           inst_var = SYX_OBJECT_DATA(inst_vars)[i-1];
00884           if (!SYX_IS_NIL (inst_var))
00885             {
00886               tot_size++;
00887               names[255-tot_size+1] = SYX_OBJECT_SYMBOL (inst_var);
00888             }
00889         }
00890     }
00891   if (tot_size > 0)
00892     {
00893       ret_names = (syx_symbol *) syx_calloc (tot_size + 1, sizeof (syx_symbol));
00894       memcpy (ret_names, &names[255-tot_size+1], tot_size * sizeof (syx_symbol));
00895     }
00896   return ret_names;
00897 }
00898 
00904 SyxOop 
00905 syx_class_lookup_method (SyxOop klass, syx_symbol selector)
00906 {
00907   SyxOop cur;
00908   SyxOop method;
00909 
00910   for (cur=klass; !SYX_IS_NIL (cur); cur = SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS (cur))
00911     {
00912       if (SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_CLASS_METHODS (cur)))
00913         continue;
00914 
00915       method = syx_dictionary_at_symbol_if_absent (SYX_CLASS_METHODS (cur), selector, syx_nil);
00916       if (!SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00917         return method;
00918     }
00919 
00920   return syx_nil;
00921 }
00922 
00928 SyxOop 
00929 syx_class_lookup_method_binding (SyxOop klass, SyxOop binding)
00930 {
00931   SyxOop cur;
00932   SyxOop method;
00933   
00934   for (cur=klass; !SYX_IS_NIL (cur); cur = SYX_CLASS_SUPERCLASS (cur))
00935     {
00936       if (SYX_IS_NIL (SYX_CLASS_METHODS (cur)))
00937         continue;
00938       
00939       SYX_VARIABLE_BINDING_DICTIONARY (binding) = SYX_CLASS_METHODS (cur);
00940       method = syx_dictionary_bind_if_absent (binding, syx_nil);
00941       if (!SYX_IS_NIL (method))
00942         return method;
00943     }
00944   
00945   return syx_nil;
00946 }
00947 
00953 void
00954 syx_semaphore_signal (SyxOop semaphore)
00955 {
00956   SyxOop signals;
00957   SyxOop list;
00958   syx_int32 i;
00959 
00960   /* FIXME: See http://www-128.ibm.com/developerworks/eserver/library/es-win32linux-sem.html */
00961 
00962   /* wait */
00963   while (_syx_sem_lock != 0);
00964   /* acquire */
00965   _syx_sem_lock++;
00966 
00967   list = SYX_SEMAPHORE_LIST(semaphore);
00968   /* add 1 because we signaled it right now */
00969   signals = SYX_SMALL_INTEGER (SYX_SEMAPHORE_SIGNALS(semaphore)) + 1;
00970 
00971   /* the i variable is used to keep track of how many processed we woke up */
00972   for (i=0; signals > 0 && SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE (list) > 0; signals--, i++)
00973     SYX_PROCESS_SUSPENDED (SYX_OBJECT_DATA(list)[i]) = syx_false;
00974 
00975   /* create a new array without signaled processes */
00976   SYX_SEMAPHORE_LIST(semaphore) = syx_array_new_ref (SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE(list) - i,
00977                                                      SYX_OBJECT_DATA(list) + i);
00978   SYX_SEMAPHORE_SIGNALS(semaphore) = syx_small_integer_new (signals);
00979 
00980   /* release */
00981   _syx_sem_lock--;
00982 }
00983 
00989 void
00990 syx_semaphore_wait (SyxOop semaphore)
00991 {
00992   SyxOop process;
00993   SyxOop list;
00994 
00995   /* wait */
00996   while (_syx_sem_lock != 0);
00997   /* acquire */
00998   _syx_sem_lock++;
00999 
01000   list = SYX_SEMAPHORE_LIST (semaphore);
01001 
01002   process = syx_processor_active_process;
01003   SYX_PROCESS_SUSPENDED (process) = syx_true;
01004   syx_object_grow_by (list, 1);
01005   SYX_OBJECT_DATA(list)[SYX_OBJECT_DATA_SIZE(list) - 1] = process;
01006 
01007   /* release */
01008   _syx_sem_lock--;
01009 }
01010 
01011 
01012 /* Small integer overflow checks */
01013 
01015 syx_bool
01016 SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_MUL_OVERFLOW (syx_int32 a, syx_int32 b)
01017 {
01018 #ifdef HAVE_INT64_T
01019   syx_int64 res = (syx_int64)a * (syx_int64)b;
01020   if ((res > INT_MAX) || (res < INT_MIN))
01021     return TRUE;
01022 #else
01023   if (a > 0) 
01024     {
01025       if (b > 0)
01026         {
01027           if (a > (INT_MAX / b))
01028             return TRUE;
01029         } 
01030       else
01031         {
01032           if (b < (INT_MIN / a))
01033             return TRUE;
01034         } 
01035     } 
01036   else
01037     { 
01038       if (b > 0)
01039         { 
01040           if (a < (INT_MIN / b))
01041             return TRUE;
01042         } 
01043       else
01044         { 
01045           if ( (a != 0) && (b < (INT_MAX / a)))
01046             return TRUE;
01047         } 
01048     }
01049 #endif
01050 
01051   return FALSE;
01052 }
01053 
01055 syx_bool
01056 SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_SHIFT_OVERFLOW (syx_int32 a, syx_int32 b)
01057 {
01058   /* Thanks to Sam Philips */
01059   syx_int32 i;
01060   syx_int32 sval;
01061 
01062   if (b <= 0)
01063     return FALSE;
01064 
01065   i = 0;
01066   sval = abs(a);
01067 
01068   while (sval >= 16)
01069     {
01070       sval = sval >> 4;
01071       i += 4;
01072     }
01073   
01074   while (sval != 0)
01075     {
01076       sval = sval >> 1;
01077       i++;
01078     }
01079   
01080   if ((i + b) > 30)
01081     return TRUE;
01082 
01083   return FALSE;
01084 }
Documented by Luca Bruno and ScaccoMatto
